_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies: This facility complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LP-Gas storage and handling. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State and Local laws and guidelines where applicable. If an emergency were to occur the Cy-Fair Volunteer Fire Department would be immediately notified and requested to respond to the emergency. We maintain fire extinguishers on site per OSHA requirements and have staff trained in their use for small minor fire response if appropriate.


A description of  facility and the regulated substances handled: This facility is a packager of aerosol and liquid cleaning products. LPG is used as a propellant in many of the aerosol products packaged. The facility consists of 5-1,000 gallon, 1-5000 gallon and 1-6,565 gallon storage tanks. 

The summary for off-site consequences (OCA)  has been removed.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at facility: This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The LP-Gas storage system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.

Five-year accident history: We have never had an accident involving LP-Gas that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

The emergency response program: In the event of an emergency involving our LP-Gas system it is our policy to notify the Cy-Fair Volunteer Fire Department and request that they help respond to the emergency.. Members of the fire department have inspected our facility so that they are familiar with our operation. Small minor fires may be handled using fire extinguishers in conjunction with Fire Department notification. 

There are no planned changes to our safety program at this time. We constantly review our safety programs and institute revisions as seem appropriate to enhance the safety
